name: cay
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small, low island in tropical regions, made of rock, sand, or coral (= a hard substance formed in the sea by groups of particular types of small animal) : There is a sparkling lagoon surrounded by coral cays. As the hurricane approached, those living on small cays and other low-lying areas were warned to head for higher ground. Synonym
key
More examplesFewer examplesThousands of migratory wetland birds use the islands' three doughnut-shape cays as a stopping point on their journey north.The people had been abandoned on a cay with no food or water.The beaches are nestled among uninhabited mangrove-covered cays.Places like Green Cay are very important habitats that support a variety of wildlife.He is a hotel manager at Parrot Cay.
